healthcarddisplay.NAME: NAME

items.question: What is a SMART® Health Card and where can I get one?
items.answer: SMART® Health Cards are paper or digital versions of your clinical information, such as vaccination history or test results. They allow you to keep a copy of your records on hand and easily share this information with others if you choose. Please visit https://smarthealth.cards for more information and details on how to obtain a SMART® Health Card.

items.question: What does it mean if you have an unsupported QR code?
items.answer: An unsupported QR code can mean that the QR code you are attempting to scan is unreadable, is not a SMART® Health Card compliant QR code, or is a SMART® Health Card that does not contain vaccination data. The organization that provided your SMART® Health Card may be able to help you obtain a new QR code.

items.question: What does it mean if your SMART® Health Card is 'Verified'?
items.answer: This means that the QR code or codes you scanned are valid SMART® Health Cards from a recognized issuing organization.

items.question: What does it mean if your SMART® Health Card is 'Partially Verified'?
items.answer: This means that the QR code or codes you scanned are valid SMART® Health Cards but come from an unrecognized issuing organization.

items.question: What does it mean if your SMART® Health Card is 'Not Verified'?
items.answer: This means that the QR code or codes you scanned are readable SMART® Health Cards but the signature from the issuing organization could not be validated, meaning the data may have been corrupted. The organization that provided your SMART® Health Card may be able to help you obtain a new QR code.

items.content: The MITRE Corporation ("MITRE," "we," "our," "us") respects the privacy of its SMART Health Card Verifier (“Verifier”) users.

The Verifier is hosted on GitHub, which provides internet hosting for software development and version control. When GitHub is visited, the visitor's IP address is logged and stored for security purposes, regardless of whether the visitor has signed into GitHub or not. For more information about GitHub's privacy and security practices, see the GitHub Privacy Statement.

We use Google Analytics, a third-party web analytics service, to help us understand and analyze how the Verifier web application is used. This service is configured so that it does not use cookies, which are data that may be sent to your web browser and stored on your computer.
For more information on how Google Analytics uses data collected through the Verifier, visit: https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/partners/. To opt out of Google analytics, visit the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on Download Page.
The Verifier web application does not use cookies.

Personally Identifiable Information or PII means information that identifies you or could reasonably be used to identify you. The Verifier web application does not collect PII and does not use PII for advertising or marketing purposes, or share it with third parties outside of the purpose of this web application.

Although the Verifier web pages on GitHub may contain links to other websites, MITRE is not responsible for the content, links, or privacy practices of those websites. It is recommended that you review the privacy policies applicable to those websites before accessing them.

When the Verifier web application is used to scan SMART® Health Cards, cardholders’ personal data—name, date of birth, and vaccination information—is temporarily displayed for verification purposes. By using the Verifier, users agree that if they have a business need to retain this information, they must first obtain the cardholder’s consent. Users agree not to record this personal data through “screen-scraping” or any other means of capturing, storing, or externally transferring cardholders’ data without consent.

The MITRE Site may change from time to time. As a result, at times it may be necessary for us to make changes to this Privacy Policy. Accordingly, MITRE reserves the right to update or modify this Privacy Policy from time to time. If MITRE makes any material changes to this Privacy Policy, they will be posted and MITRE will concurrently update the “Effective Date” of this Privacy Policy stated above. Please review this Privacy Policy periodically, and especially before you provide any information. Your continued use of the MITRE Site after any changes or revisions to this Privacy Policy shall indicate your agreement with the terms of such revised Privacy Policy.

Please send your privacy-related comments or questions regarding use of the Verifier to Privacy@MITRE.org. We will do our best to respond to all reasonable inquiries in a timely manner. For application-related questions and comments, please contact us at vci-developers@mitre.org.
